pullRequest.body:
In some recently added results, pointwise convergence of constant indicators of sets was phrased in terms of `Tendsto` in the product topology. The relevant notion is more elementary, however: it is (usually) equivalent to eventually constantness of the set membership of any point; in particular the topology of the underlying set plays almost no role (apart from mild separation axioms). This PR adds equivalences between the conditions and refactors some results.

Co-authored-by: Floris van Doorn  <@fpvandoorn>.

---

The better phrasing was suggested by @fpvandoorn in #6850.

Thanks! The build failed, probably due to changes in `simp` lemmas. I merged master and fixed the broken proofs.

bors d+
bors merge

:v: kkytola can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6988504706/job/19016142886)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6988504706/job/19016142784)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6988504706/job/19016142716)
This added import is light. The new file is less than 75 lines and should not import anything new transitively.

Is there a better place for these analogues of `Mathlib.Topology.IndicatorConstPointwise`? They are (now) needed in `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Constructions.BorelSpace.Metrizable` and `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.Lebesgue` (they have for example `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.MeasureSpace` as a common ancestor, but this file or a completely new one seem more appropriate places).

Maybe these lemmas are not needed anymore if you prove `tendsto_indicator_const_iff_forall_eventually` for a single `x` (which is a reformulation of `tendsto_ite` mentioned elsewhere), because then you can just `simp_rw` with that lemma?
This added import is light. The new file is less than 75 lines and should not import anything new transitively.

```suggestion
    (h_lim : ∀ x, ∀ᶠ i in L, x ∈ As i ↔ x ∈ A) :
```
also in all other `∀ᶠ` notations
Please move some more variables here, at least `{β : Type*} [Zero β] [TopologicalSpace β]`
Also, you don't use `[IsCountablyGenerated L]`
Since `B` and `O` do not appear in the conclusion, I would just replace the assumptions by `{0}ᶜ ∈ 𝓝 b` and `{b}ᶜ ∈ 𝓝 0`.

I think this is the heart of this lemma:
```lean
lemma tendsto_ite {β : Type*} {p : ι → Prop} [DecidablePred p] {q : Prop} [Decidable q]
    {a b : β} {F G : Filter β} (h1 : {a}ᶜ ∈ G) (h1 : {b}ᶜ ∈ F) :
    Tendsto (fun i ↦ if p i then a else b) L (if q then F else G) ↔ 
      ∀ᶠ i in L, p i ↔ q := by sorry
```
That might be nice to add, and your version should only be a few lines afterwards.

This version also doesn't use topology.

(There is probably also a version where `a` and `b` may depend on `i`, and where `{a}` is then replaced by `range a`, but that might be overkill).
I could only prove `tendsto_ite` after adding the hypotheses `(haF : principal {a} ≤ F)` and ` (hbG : principal {b} ≤ G)`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: better phrasing of pointwise convergence of indicators
